remarks: The sigma-algebra generated by the dyadic closed-below, open-above rectangular subsets of ` ( RR X. RR ) ` is a subset of the sigma algebra generated by the closed half-spaces of ` ( RR X. RR ) ` . The proof goes by noting the fact that the dyadic rectangles are intersections of a 'vertical band' and an 'horizontal band', which themselves are differences of closed half-spaces.  (Contributed by Thierry Arnoux, 17-Sep-2017.)
